Class Property<T>

java.lang.Object
taskmanagement.application.viewmodel.events.Property<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the property's value (nullable)
public final class Property<T> extends Object
Observable property implementing the Observer pattern.

Listeners can subscribe via addListener(Listener) and will be notified whenever the property's value is set or explicitly refreshed.

Important: setValue(Object) always notifies listeners, even if the old and new values are equal according to Objects.equals(Object, Object). This ensures in-place updates (e.g., mutable objects) still trigger a refresh.

    • getValue

      public T getValue()
      Returns the current value of this property.
      Returns:

    • setValue

      public void setValue(T newValue)
      Sets a new value and always notifies listeners, regardless of equality.
      Parameters:
      newValue - the new value (nullable)

    • setValueIfChanged

      public void setValueIfChanged(T newValue)
      Sets a new value and notifies listeners only if the value has changed according to Objects.equals(Object, Object).
      Parameters:
      newValue - the new value (nullable)

    • fireChange

      public void fireChange()
      Notifies listeners of a change without modifying the current value. Useful when the current value is mutable and has been updated in place.

    • addListener

      public void addListener(Property.Listener<T> l)
      Registers a new listener to be notified of property changes. Duplicate additions are ignored.
      Parameters:
      l - the listener to add (must not be null)

    • removeListener

      public void removeListener(Property.Listener<T> l)
      Removes a previously registered listener. Does nothing if the listener is not registered.
      Parameters:
      l - the listener to remove
